t: Philemon 1
Paul,*p a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
And*p to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
Grace*p to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
I*p thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
Hearing*p of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
That*p the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
For*p we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
Wherefore,*p though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
Yet*p for love's sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
I*p beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
Which*p in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
Whom*p I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
Whom*p I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
But*p without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
For*p perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
Not*p now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
If*p thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
If*p he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
I*p Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
Yea,*p brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
Having*p confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
But*p withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
There*p salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
Mark,*p Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellowlabourers.
The*p grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
